data.name: Are Module Boundaries also Security Boundaries?
data.description:
I once asked if module boundaries are also security boundaries.  
More specifically, is it safe to grant `ReflectPermission("suppressAccessChecks")` to untrusted code that is running in a named module?

After some pondering about the problem I found that the answer is no.
There is still a way to escape the sandbox with this one additional permission.

Your code is executed in the default java sandbox with one additional `Permission`: `ReflectPermission("suppressAccessChecks")` and put into a named module.

The goal is to disable the `SecurityManager`.

The preloaded code is in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/DasBrain/85091d698c0a335d6d5c0a2045211dcf), but it is only needed on codewars.  
Normally I would use the `java.policy` property and the `--illegal-access=deny` vm option.
